characteristics.description: 1" purplish-red cherry, prolific vines, 6-8 fruits per truss
Deeply ribbed 6-8 oz fruits, thick walls, meaty texture
Cylindrical cream to pale yellow, compact plants, best harvested at 3"
Dark purplish-brown 2-oz cherry, high anthocyanin, 6-8 per cluster, 5' vines
Compact cherry, 1/2-oz yellow fruits, container-friendly
Large beefsteak, yellow-orange with red hints
Extra-prolific cherry, long multiple-branched clusters
30" plants, 4-5" medium-hot, mature green to dark red
1.5" sweet with candy cane stripes, variegated foliage, ripen green/white to chocolate red/cream
2-4" slender, citrusy slightly smoky, 50-200 Scoville (mildly hot), highly productive
Compact 8" plants, upright 1.5-3" red, 50,000-100,000 Scoville units
Flowers early summer. Deep green buds with light purple tint. 3-4 heads per summer
Spineless, early mature, productive. Dark green grooved straight pods, full-bodied flavor. Beautiful flowers
Stunning crimson pods, yellow flowers, prolific in heat. Most productive red variety, tender 6" pods. AAS winner 1988
Prolific leaf growth, deep emerald glossy green, herbal tower form. Delays flowering 12+ weeks. Annual
Mild sweet taste, perfect for pesto/pasta/salads. Pink-tinted vinegar/oil. Tomato companion. Annual
Popular in SE Asian cuisine, holds flavor after cooking. Dark purple flowers, anise/clove hints. Terrific for containers. Annual
12-18" tall. Harvest morning when cool. Complete harvest before flowering. Cut to 4-6" for second growth. Annual
10-18" tall. Edible flowers. Grows best in clumps. Frost hardy. Perennial
12-28" tall. Cool season crop (50-85°F ideal). Leaves=cilantro, seeds=coriander. Bolts above 85°F. Tolerates light frost. Annual
24-36" tall. Low water needs except in containers. Heat and frost tolerant. Annual
18-24" tall. Perennial in Zone 5+. 2nd year maturity. Well-drained, fairly dry soil. Trim every 3 years. Heat tolerant
Heirloom. Perennial. Versatile, refreshing for drinks, jellies, dishes, crafts, bath
Perennial. Enhances drinks, savory dishes, meats, stews. Tiny flowers attract bees. Deer resistant
Perennial, will spread. Water when dry
Biennial. Leaves 1st year, flowers/seed 2nd year. Annual plantings recommended. Keep moist
Heirloom. Perennial zone 8+, annual elsewhere. Piney flavor for meats/veggies/bread. Lavender flowers attract pollinators. Drought tolerant. Deer resistant
Perennial. Loves dry, dislikes humidity. Max 50% harvest. Let establish before first harvest
Perennial. Shear whole plant at 4" if spindly for denser regrowth
Vigorous climbing Asian vine, flourishes in heat/humidity. Glossy thick leaves, mild Swiss chard-like taste
Vigorous climbing vine, loves summer heat/humidity. Glossy thick leaves, mild Swiss chard taste
Compact 20-24" stalks, 50-100 dark-green 1¼-1½" sprouts. Excellent nutrition, freezes well
Chinese cabbage variety
Blend of Red and White Russian. Deeply seriated curly leaves, tender for salad/bunching. Frost improves flavor
Crisp loose heads, broad light-green frilled crumpled leaves, delicate flavor
Custom mesclun blend for fresh beautiful salads. No thinning required for baby greens
Fast-growing, peppery spicy flavor. Young leaves mild for salads, mature best cooked. Cold hardy, heat tolerant
Heirloom. Perennial. Peppery pungent, high in vitamins A/C/K, potassium, calcium. Antioxidant properties. Grows in moist shady areas or containers
Heirloom since 1892. Tender buttery-sweet 2½-3" deep crimson beets, won't get woody when large. Greens tasty, iron-rich. Perfect for pickling/roasting/raw
Bred by Sugar Snap creator. Stringless pods, short 24-30" vines, improved disease resistance. No support needed but helps harvest. Powdery mildew resistant
Heirloom. High yielding 12" bunching onions (scallions), sweet mild flavor
Annual. Blue/pink/ruby-red/white shades. Larger than common Bachelor Buttons. Prolific, minimal care
Annual. Compact uniform cockscomb, hundreds of tiny flowers in tight waves. Long-lasting, attracts pollinators. Heat/drought tolerant. 16-30" tall
Annual. Colorful foliage: white/bronze/gold/copper/yellow/pink/red/purple. Excellent houseplant. Brightens shady areas. Deer resistant. 12-36" tall
Annual. Lacy sprays of tiny celestial blue blossoms. Compact tough versatile plants. Attracts bees
Perennial. Leafy spikes of bell-shaped blooms. White/shell-pink/deep-rose with crimson/maroon/chocolate markings. Do not ingest seeds
Annual. Large majestic 4" blooms in tangerine/gold/yellow. Mounding form, consistent height, sturdy stalks. Drought tolerant. Deer/rabbit resistant. 24-36" tall
Annual. Giant cactus flowered, brilliant colors. Quilled gracefully curved petals in multiple rows
